result.execSummary:
The defendant Karie L Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Plea hearing on August 1, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Body Only

11:09 a.m. Defendant Karie L Decorah not in court.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the history of the case.  11:12 a.m.  Attorney Gardner appears and addresses the Court requesting that a WA not be issued.  Attorney Gardner explains where the defendant is.  Court explains what he wants done before the warrant would be dismissed.  Attorney Gardner requests that the information he provides to the Court be sealed and the Court agrees.
Plea hearing on June 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:02 Defendant Karie L Decorah in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gardner informs the court that Decorah is currently in In Patient Treatment in Michigan.  Moves court to adjourn the plea hearing and that within 5 days the defense will provide verification of Decorah's placement in that facility.  Would like a 2 week continuance.  

Court sets matter out for 2 weeks and orders that Atty Gardner track down the Defendant and provide verification.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.
